body:
In the older version (which I think you are in) you still have to declare that the model is functional through Scan(functional_model=True) but in the latest version (0.4.4) this is no longer needed and you can run both Sequential and Functional models as-is. Can you make sure you have the latest version: 

```
pip uninstall talos 
pip install git+https://github.com/autonomio/talos@daily-dev 
```
After that you should not have this problem anymore.

issue.title: How do I pass in a list of inputs?

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

issue.body:
In most talos code examples, X input seems to be a 2D numpy array.
But in some of my keras models, it requires a list of 2D numpy arrays because my models are not `Sequential`.
Example list: `[numpyarray1, numpyarray2, numpyarray3]`.

It seems that when I try to pass this list to the `ta.Scan` function, things break.

How do I pass in a list of inputs?

Also, I'm not sure if `talos` supports `pandas` DataFrame or not. But I think it does not support so please do make support for it.

body:
I have version 0.4.3 from printing `talos.__version__`. Is this still old?
Because I have just recently installed this a moment ago.
Yes, the issue you are suffering from will be simply resolved by upgrade. I guess you installed with pip which means you get the 0.4.3 currently.

I typed `pip install -U talos` and here's the output:
```
Requirement already up-to-date: talos in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (0.4.3)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: chances in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (0.1.1)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: astetik in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (1.9.5)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: wrangle in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (0.3.1)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: keras in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (2.2.4)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: tqdm in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (4.28.1)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: kerasplotlib in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from talos) (0.1.4)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: geonamescache in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from astetik->talos) (1.0.1)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: h5py in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (2.7.0)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: scipy>=0.14 in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (1.1.0)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: numpy>=1.9.1 in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (1.15.4)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: keras-preprocessing>=1.0.5 in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (1.0.5)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: six>=1.9.0 in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (1.10.0)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: keras-applications>=1.0.6 in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (1.0.6)
Requirement already satisfied, skipping upgrade: pyyaml in c:\users\admin\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from keras->talos) (3.12)
```
It said that it's already up to date.

That will not work because it will just try to install the latest version from pypi. You have to follow:

```
pip uninstall talos 
pip install git+https://github.com/autonomio/talos@daily-dev  
```
This error is eliminated when I upgrade the version but it's still related to this issue: #132

issue.title: Working with Predict without saving a file

labels.name: topic: documentation
labels.description: better doc strings or comments needed

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

issue.body:
Hello,

Using Talos every day for the past week or so. Working with lots of models which I run `predict()` on for validation. I am having an issue trying to find a way to predict without having to create a file. I've got a large core box running 24/7 creating lots of models. I would rather not create so many directories and zips for the models.   I forked and made a quick change to the `deploy()` command by pulling all the saving into another function and adding a flag to pass to init, also having it return an activate model when given the model specs just like restore does. 

I am wondering if I missed something in the documentation or in the code that will allow me to use the prediction on a keras model object without send the scan obejct to a file via csv or with deploy. 

 - if there **is** a way point it out to me and I will update the documentation and put in a pull request
 - if there **isn't** a way and this is something that is applicable to contribute I will happily make my _first_ contribution

Thanks!

issue.title: add "predict with best model" to Scan object

repository.name: talos
repository.description: Hyperparameter Optimization for TensorFlow, Keras and PyTorch

issue.body: The idea came up in #132 and some other issues previously. This seems to be a simple, yet highly useful addition to the Scan object.
